H0.text: Ribosomes are organelles made of protein and ribosomal rna that build cellular proteins in the cytoplasm.

H1.text: Chloroplasts are organelles made of protein and ribosomal RNA that build cellular proteins in the cytoplasm.

H2.text: DNA is the organelle made of protein and ribosomal RNA that builds cellular proteins in the cytoplasm.

H3.text: Chromosomes are organelles made of protein and ribosomal RNA that build cellular proteins in the cytoplasm.

A4.text: Ribosomes are referred to as organelles, but the term organelle is often restricted to subâ€‘cellular components that include a phospholipid membrane, which ribosomes, being entirely particulate, do not.

A5.text: Ribosomes link amino acids together in the order specified by the codons of messenger RNA molecules to form polypeptide chains.

A6.text: Lab computer simulates ribosome in motion

A7.text: 3D electron microscopy structures of ribosomes at the EM Data Bank (EMDB)
